doc:
Mary Ellis https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Ellis 0 Mary Ellis (June 15, 1897 – January 30, 2003) was an American actress and singer appearing on stage, radio, television and film, best known for her musical theatre roles, particularly in Ivor Novello works. After appearing with the Metropolitan Opera beginning in 1918, she acted on Broadway, creating the title role in Rose-Marie. In 1930, she emigrated to England, where she gained additional fame and continued to perform into the 1990s. She also became known for film roles, including in The 3 Worlds of Gulliver in 1960. Mary_Ellis ( June_15_,_1897 – January_30_,_2003 ) was an_American_actress_and_singer appearing on stage_,_radio_,_television_and_film , best_known for her_musical_theatre_roles , particularly in Ivor_Novello works . After appearing with the_Metropolitan_Opera beginning in 1918 , she acted on Broadway , creating the_title_role in Rose-Marie . In 1930 , she emigrated to England , where she gained additional_fame and continued_to_perform into the_1990s . She also became_known for film_roles , including in The_3_Worlds of Gulliver in 1960 .
